snippet: Despite having dismissed President Obama just last week as a weak leader, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, a Republican, was full of praise for him this week, calling him “outstanding.”
abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie puts partisan politics aside, praising Pres Obama's handling of Hurricane Sandy, despite recently having dismissed him as a weak leader; Christie had been scheduled to campaign for Mitt Romney, but has embraced the bipartisan moment; both Christie and Obama say storm has provide an opportunity for a successful bipartisan relationship.
lead_paragraph: Despite having dismissed President Obama just last week as a weak leader, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, a Republican, was full of praise for him this week, calling him “outstanding.”

headline.seo: In Stunning About-face, Chris Christie Heaps Praise on Obama
headline.main: One Result of Hurricane: Bipartisanship Flows
headline.print_headline: One Result of Hurricane: Bipartisanship Flows
